class.name: Vector3
class.brief_description: Vector class, which performs basic 3D vector math operations.
class.description: Vector3 is one of the core classes of the engine, and includes several built-in helper functions to perform basic vector math operations.

method.name: Vector3
method.description: Returns a Vector3 with the given components.

method.name: abs
method.description: Returns a new vector with all components in absolute values (i.e. positive).

method.name: angle_to
method.description: Returns the minimum angle to the given vector.

method.name: bounce
method.description: Returns the vector "bounced off" from a plane defined by the given normal.

method.name: ceil
method.description: Returns a new vector with all components rounded up.

method.name: cross
method.description: Returns the cross product with [code]b[/code].

method.name: cubic_interpolate
method.description: Performs a cubic interpolation between vectors [code]pre_a[/code], [code]a[/code], [code]b[/code], [code]post_b[/code] ([code]a[/code] is current), by the given amount [code]t[/code]. [code]t[/code] is in the range of [code]0.0 - 1.0[/code], representing the amount of interpolation.

method.name: distance_squared_to
method.description: Returns the squared distance to [code]b[/code]. Prefer this function over [method distance_to] if you need to sort vectors or need the squared distance for some formula.

method.name: distance_to
method.description: Returns the distance to [code]b[/code].

method.name: dot
method.description: Returns the dot product with [code]b[/code].

method.name: floor
method.description: Returns a new vector with all components rounded down.

method.name: inverse
method.description: Returns the inverse of the vector. This is the same as [code]Vector3( 1.0 / v.x, 1.0 / v.y, 1.0 / v.z )[/code].

method.name: is_normalized
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the vector is normalized.

method.name: length
method.description: Returns the vector's length.

method.name: length_squared
method.description: Returns the vector's length squared. Prefer this function over [method length] if you need to sort vectors or need the squared length for some formula.

method.name: linear_interpolate
method.description: Returns the result of the linear interpolation between this vector and [code]b[/code] by amount [code]t[/code]. [code]t[/code] is in the range of [code]0.0 - 1.0[/code], representing the amount of interpolation..

method.name: max_axis
method.description: Returns the axis of the vector's largest value. See [code]AXIS_*[/code] constants.

method.name: min_axis
method.description: Returns the axis of the vector's smallest value. See [code]AXIS_*[/code] constants.

method.name: normalized
method.description: Returns the vector scaled to unit length. Equivalent to [code]v / v.length()[/code].

method.name: outer
method.description: Returns the outer product with [code]b[/code].

method.name: project
method.description: Returns the vector projected onto the vector [code]b[/code].

method.name: reflect
method.description: Returns the vector reflected from a plane defined by the given normal.

method.name: rotated
method.description: Rotates the vector around a given axis by [code]phi[/code] radians. The axis must be a normalized vector.

method.name: round
method.description: Returns the vector with all components rounded to the nearest integer, with halfway cases rounded away from zero.

method.name: slerp
method.description: Returns the result of SLERP between this vector and [code]b[/code], by amount [code]t[/code]. [code]t[/code] is in the range of [code]0.0 - 1.0[/code], representing the amount of interpolation. Both vectors need to be normalized.

method.name: slide
method.description: Returns the component of the vector along a plane defined by the given normal.

method.name: snapped
method.description: Returns a copy of the vector, snapped to the lowest neared multiple.

method.name: to_diagonal_matrix
method.description: Returns a diagonal matrix with the vector as main diagonal.

members.member: The vector's x component. Also accessible by using the index position [code][0][/code].
The vector's y component. Also accessible by using the index position [code][1][/code].
The vector's z component. Also accessible by using the index position [code][2][/code].

constants.constant: Enumerated value for the X axis. Returned by [method max_axis] and [method min_axis].
Enumerated value for the Y axis.
Enumerated value for the Z axis.
